cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles SE of St. Croix, or 130 miles SE of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest across the northern Caribbean, forecast to turn northwest over the Gulf of Mexico and aim toward the southwest Louisiana–upper Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-west Louisiana coast near or just west of Lake Charles

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect along U.S. Gulf coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect along U.S. Gulf coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northwest Gulf Coast from upper Texas through Mississippi, including southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Growing potential for sustained tropical-storm-force winds and gusts to hurricane force at the port if Laura intensifies before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests surge of 3–5 ft or higher along the Calcasieu Pass and adjacent coastal areas, producing coastal flooding around the harbor.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deliver 4–6 inches or more, causing flash and urban flooding in the Lake Charles area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Possible river flooding, debris from strong winds, and temporary channel shoaling that can hamper port operations.
